Class Pile

  • java.lang.Object
    • Pile

  • public class Pile
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the pile in the middle in the AviBS project
    Author:
    Harsh, Susan

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Pile()
      Constructs a new pile and initializes an ArrayList for the current pile, an ArrayList for the most recently added card(s), and an int to refer to the current card's value.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCards(java.util.ArrayList<Card> c, int type)
      Adds the cards that a player plays to the pile as well as the card type if it's the first turn/starting off a new pile
      Player bluffCalled(Player currentPlayer, Player lastPlayer)
      Checks to see if a bluff that's called is valid/correct.
      int getCurrentCard()
      Gets current value of the card that's in play
      java.lang.String getLastAdd()
      Returns a string containing all of the cards that were played on the most recent turn
      int getNumOfCards()
      Gets the number of cards that are currenetly in pile
      java.lang.String getPile()
      Returns a string containing all of the cards that are in the pile
      boolean hasCurrentCard()
      Checks if the pile contains the current card

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pile

        public Pile()
        Constructs a new pile and initializes an ArrayList for the current pile, an ArrayList for the most recently added card(s), and an int to refer to the current card's value.

    • Method Detail

      • addCards

        public void addCards(java.util.ArrayList<Card> c,
                     int type)
        Adds the cards that a player plays to the pile as well as the card type if it's the first turn/starting off a new pile
        Parameters:
        c - cards that the player plays
        type - number that the player plays them as (on the first turn only)

      • bluffCalled

        public Player bluffCalled(Player currentPlayer,
                          Player lastPlayer)
        Checks to see if a bluff that's called is valid/correct. If so, the player who called the bluff gets all the cards. If not, the player who played the wrong card gets the pile.
        Parameters:
        currentPlayer - the player who called the bluff
        lastPlayer - the last player who played a card
        Returns:
        the player who is correct

      • getLastAdd

        public java.lang.String getLastAdd()
        Returns a string containing all of the cards that were played on the most recent turn
        Returns:
        the cards that were most recently played

      • getPile

        public java.lang.String getPile()
        Returns a string containing all of the cards that are in the pile
        Returns:
        the cards in the pile

      • hasCurrentCard

        public boolean hasCurrentCard()
        Checks if the pile contains the current card
        Returns:
        true if it does, false if not

      • getCurrentCard

        public int getCurrentCard()
        Gets current value of the card that's in play
        Returns:
        the value of the current card

      • getNumOfCards

        public int getNumOfCards()
        Gets the number of cards that are currenetly in pile
        Returns:
        the number of cards in pile
